entry.title: Fwd: death by halving
entry.summary: In a 2014 email exchange between Gavin Andresen and Ferdinando M. Ametrano, Andresen questioned whether the next bitcoin halving event would be different from the previous one. Ametrano responded by noting that in November 2008, bitcoin was a younger ecosystem and the halving occurred during a relatively stable price trend. He also pointed out that while halving is not strictly necessary to follow Nakamoto's monetary rule, many people have planned around its current behavior, which has not caused any problems. Additionally, there are potential benefits such as encouraging investment in mining infrastructure. Ametrano considered the discussion a waste of time and noted the complexity of the system beyond the subsidy schedule.
